    • Field Detail

      • sunCount

        public int sunCount
        This variable holds the number of suns in the game. Suns are the currency used to buy plants which can then be planted.

      • sunflowerNumber

        public int sunflowerNumber
        This variable holds the number of sunflower plants in the game. This is important because the suns will be updated at a time interval and this is determined by adding what is already currently present to the number of sunflowers multiplied by a constant.

      • target

        public int target
        This variable determines the number of zombies you need to kill. If you can defeat all the zombies (or get this to 0), you win!

      • zombieMath

        public double zombieMath
        This variable is used to determine which zombie's turn it is to be placed.

      • statusLabel

        public java.lang.String statusLabel
        Determines what the label "Status" should display (whether or not the player won, lost, or still needs to defeat zombies).

      • timer

        public java.util.Timer timer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gui1

        public Gui1()
        Gui1 is the constructor responsible for making the game display. Within it are many methods which create the game board seen when playing and the timers which determine when events occur.

    • Method Detail

      • getSunCount

        public int getSunCount()
        Obtains the current number of "suns" (currency used to insert various plants) available.
        Returns:
        the number of "suns" currently in the game

      • setSunCount

        public void setSunCount(int sunCount)
        Applies changes towards the number of "suns" in the game towards the variable holding the number.
        Parameters:
        sunCount - the number that the variable "sunCount" is meant to become

      • counterChange

        public void counterChange()
        Reflects any change in the variable holding the number of "suns" in the label which displays the number.

      • getSf

        public int getSf()
        Obtains the number of "Sunflower" plants currently on the field.
        Returns:
        the number of "Sunflower" on the grid

      • setSf

        public void setSf(int sunflowerNumber)
        Applies changes towards the number of "Sunflower" plants in the game towards the variable keeping track of the number.
        Parameters:
        sunflowerNumber - the number that the variable "sunflowerNumber" is meant to become

      • getTarget

        public int getTarget()
        Obtains the number of "zombies" that need to be killed before winning the game.
        Returns:
        the number of "zombies" that need to be defeated

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(int n)
        Applies changes towards the number of "zombies" that still need to be defeated.
        Parameters:
        n - the number that the variable "target" is meant to become

      • statusChange

        public void statusChange()
        Edits the label which states the game's current position (whether or not the player has won or lost and how many zombies still need to be played)

      • gridMaker

        public void gridMaker()
        Initializes the layout and 2D button array utilized in making the grid.Also feeds variables to signify coordinates into the method buttonMaker.

      • buttonMaker

        public void buttonMaker(int x,
               int y)
        Uses the variables received from various methods to create the buttons in the grid and to provide them with some client properties.
        Parameters:
        x - the column to place the button in
        y - the row to place the button in

      • addPlant

        public void addPlant(int column,
            int row,
            int type)
        Places a certain type of plant on a button depending on the radio buttons selected.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to place the plant in
        row - the row to place the plant in
        type - the kind of plant to place Key: 1 = Sunflower, 2 = Pea Shooter, 3 = Chomper, 4 = Gatling Pea Shooter

      • addZombie

        public void addZombie(int column,
             int row,
             int health,
             int type)
        Adds "zombies" into the game field from the right.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to place the "zombie" in
        row - the row to place the "zombie" in
        health - the amount of endurance the "zombie" should have and the number of hits the "zombie" can receive before disappearing
        type - the kind of zombie that should be added Key: 1 = Normal, 2 = Conehead

      • moveZombie

        public void moveZombie()
        Creates movement for zombies which is utilized in the Move class

      • addProjectile

        public void addProjectile(int column,
                 int row,
                 int projectileSet)
        Creates the projectile in front of a shooter plant.
        Parameters:
        column - the column to place the projectile in
        row - the row to place the projectile in
        projectileSet - the strength the projectile should have

      • moveProjectile

        public void moveProjectile(int column,
                  int row)
        Moves existing projectiles to the right and applies effects on zombies if applicable in a situation.
        Parameters:
        column - the column the projectile is currently on
        row - the row the projectile is currently on

      • chomp

        public void chomp()
        Allows chomper plants to defeat zombies in front of them and placing limits on their ability to do so.

      • killProjectiles

        public void killProjectiles()
        Gets rid of any projectiles coming from a shooter that has been eliminated.

      • zombieBehind

        public boolean zombieBehind(int col,
                   int row)
        Determines if a projectile has passed beyond a zombie it should have hit.
        Parameters:
        col - the column the projectile is in
        row - the row the projectile is in
        Returns:
        the boolean which determines if the projectile has passed a zombie

      • zombieDie

        public boolean zombieDie(int column,
                int row)
        Establishes whether or not the image on a button should disappear.
        Parameters:
        column - the column the zombie is on
        row - the row the zombie is on
        Returns:
        the boolean which determines whether or not the object disappears
